Sentencas: Glass ceramic composites are among the favorable candidates as a sealing material for solid oxide fuel cells (SOFC).
Titulo: Optimum processing parameters to improve sealing performance in solid oxide fuel cells

Sentencas: In order to obtain a reliable, robust and hermetic sealing, the glass ceramics must chemically bond to both the metallic interconnector and the ceramic electrolyte.
Titulo: Optimum processing parameters to improve sealing performance in solid oxide fuel cells

Sentencas: A high-bonding strength and good wetting, which strongly depend on the thermal treatment, are always preferred to ensure gas-tight sealing.
Titulo: Optimum processing parameters to improve sealing performance in solid oxide fuel cells

Sentencas: The thermal treatment involves three stages: binder burnout (stage-I), sintering (stage-II), and cooling (stage-III).
Titulo: Optimum processing parameters to improve sealing performance in solid oxide fuel cells

Sentencas: This study investigates effects of various parameters on the sealing quality at the sintering stage.
Titulo: Optimum processing parameters to improve sealing performance in solid oxide fuel cells

Sentencas: The effects of sintering temperature, clamping pressure and sealant thickness are considered.
Titulo: Optimum processing parameters to improve sealing performance in solid oxide fuel cells

Sentencas: The glass ceramic laminates are produced employing a tape casting method.
Titulo: Optimum processing parameters to improve sealing performance in solid oxide fuel cells

Sentencas: The sealing quality is evaluated by measuring leakage and final macro-structure of the sealing region.
Titulo: Optimum processing parameters to improve sealing performance in solid oxide fuel cells

Sentencas: It is suggested that a 900-930 degrees C sintering temperature and 1.5-7.6 N cm(-2) clamping pressure ranges are better for successful sealing.
Titulo: Optimum processing parameters to improve sealing performance in solid oxide fuel cells

Sentencas: The initial thickness of glass ceramic laminates is also desired to be between 0.25-0.5 mm thickness range for both a cost-effective and reliable sealing.
Titulo: Optimum processing parameters to improve sealing performance in solid oxide fuel cells
